thread.title: Live owls are coming to Manchester Central Library this weekend
thread.title_full: Live owls are coming to Manchester Central Library this weekend

author: Sarah Walters
title: Live owls are coming to Manchester Central Library this weekend
text:
Live owls are coming to Manchester Central Library this weekend The event is a celebration of Harry Potter - so these birds can deliver letters. Natch... Share Get What's On   Thank you for subscribing! Could   
Eat your heart out Hedwig, because there's a parliament of owls headed for Manchester to show off their Hogwarts-style skills. 
The visiting owls will be at Manchester Central Library from midday on Saturday, February 4 as part of the annual international celebrations of J.K. Rowling's classic children's book Harry Potter . 
They'll be delivering letters to their handlers once an hour - just like Hedwig did for Harry - at the library's special event, A Harry Potter Celebration. 
And the squad chosen to emulate Hedwig's spellbinding skills is expected to include everything from a White Faced Owl to the grand European Eagle Owl. Read More 
A team of trained handlers will fly the owls every half past the hour starting at 12.30 and finishing with the final flights at 3.30pm. Manchester Central Library (Photo: Mark Waugh) 
As well as inviting in the visiting owls, the library will also mark Harry Potter Book Night with visits from Albus Dumbledore and Harry Potter, the Sorting Hat will be doing what it does best and sorting people while a wizard will be casting spells, and there are even craft sessions, quizzes, and green screens to keep the little ones entertained. Read More 
The event is free, although the organiser warns that the workshops with the Professors of Hogwarts are now fully booked. All other experiences do not require a ticket. 
A Harry Potter Celebration runs from 12pm until 4pm as part of the ongoing Library Live season. 
Costumes, wands and Butterbeer tankards are optional! Like us on Facebook
